p: Essential oils (eucalyptus oil, tea tree oil, and thyme oil) and monoterpenes like isoborneol proved antiviral activities against HSV-1 by inhibiting glycosylation of viral proteins ( Astani et al., 2010). Silymarin (from the seeds of Silybum marianum) and catechin (present in green tea extract) inhibited HCV and also displayed anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory actions ( Calland et al., 2012). Table 2 illustrates antiviral properties of various plants associated metabolites against deadly viruses.
